026/** Provide access to the network communication data to / from the Driver Station. */
027public class DriverStation {
028  /** Number of Joystick Ports. */
029  public static final int kJoystickPorts = 6;
030
031  private static class HALJoystickButtons {
032    public int m_buttons;
033    public byte m_count;
034  }
035
036  private static class HALJoystickAxes {
037    public float[] m_axes;
038    public short m_count;
039
040    HALJoystickAxes(int count) {
041      m_axes = new float[count];
042    }
043  }
044
045  private static class HALJoystickPOVs {
046    public short[] m_povs;
047    public short m_count;
048
049    HALJoystickPOVs(int count) {
050      m_povs = new short[count];
051      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
052        m_povs[i] = -1;
053      }
054    }
055  }
056
057  /** The robot alliance that the robot is a part of. */
058  public enum Alliance {
059    Red,
060    Blue,
061    Invalid
062  }
063
064  public enum MatchType {
065    None,
066    Practice,
067    Qualification,
068    Elimination
069  }
070
071  private static final double JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL = 1.0;
072  private static double m_nextMessageTime;
073
074  private static class DriverStationTask implements Runnable {
075    DriverStationTask() {}
076
077    @Override
078    public void run() {
079      DriverStation.run();
080    }
081  } /* DriverStationTask */
082
083  private static class MatchDataSender {
084    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
085    NetworkTable table;
086
087    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
088    NetworkTableEntry typeMetadata;
089
090    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
091    NetworkTableEntry gameSpecificMessage;
092
093    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
094    NetworkTableEntry eventName;
095
096    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
097    NetworkTableEntry matchNumber;
098
099    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
100    NetworkTableEntry replayNumber;
101
102    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
103    NetworkTableEntry matchType;
104
105    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
106    NetworkTableEntry alliance;
107
108    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
109    NetworkTableEntry station;
110
111    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
112    NetworkTableEntry controlWord;
113
114    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
115    boolean oldIsRedAlliance = true;
116
117    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
118    int oldStationNumber = 1;
119
120    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
121    String oldEventName = "";
122
123    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
124    String oldGameSpecificMessage = "";
125
126    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
127    int oldMatchNumber;
128
129    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
130    int oldReplayNumber;
131
132    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
133    int oldMatchType;
134
135    @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
136    int oldControlWord;
137
138    MatchDataSender() {
139      table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("FMSInfo");
140      typeMetadata = table.getEntry(".type");
141      typeMetadata.forceSetString("FMSInfo");
142      gameSpecificMessage = table.getEntry("GameSpecificMessage");
143      gameSpecificMessage.forceSetString("");
144      eventName = table.getEntry("EventName");
145      eventName.forceSetString("");
146      matchNumber = table.getEntry("MatchNumber");
147      matchNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
148      replayNumber = table.getEntry("ReplayNumber");
149      replayNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
150      matchType = table.getEntry("MatchType");
151      matchType.forceSetDouble(0);
152      alliance = table.getEntry("IsRedAlliance");
153      alliance.forceSetBoolean(true);
154      station = table.getEntry("StationNumber");
155      station.forceSetDouble(1);
156      controlWord = table.getEntry("FMSControlData");
157      controlWord.forceSetDouble(0);
158    }
159
160    private void sendMatchData() {
161      AllianceStationID allianceID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
162      boolean isRedAlliance = false;
163      int stationNumber = 1;
164      switch (allianceID) {
165        case Blue1:
166          isRedAlliance = false;
167          stationNumber = 1;
168          break;
169        case Blue2:
170          isRedAlliance = false;
171          stationNumber = 2;
172          break;
173        case Blue3:
174          isRedAlliance = false;
175          stationNumber = 3;
176          break;
177        case Red1:
178          isRedAlliance = true;
179          stationNumber = 1;
180          break;
181        case Red2:
182          isRedAlliance = true;
183          stationNumber = 2;
184          break;
185        default:
186          isRedAlliance = true;
187          stationNumber = 3;
188          break;
189      }
190
191      String currentEventName;
192      String currentGameSpecificMessage;
193      int currentMatchNumber;
194      int currentReplayNumber;
195      int currentMatchType;
196      int currentControlWord;
197      m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
198      try {
199        currentEventName = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.eventName;
200        currentGameSpecificMessage = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
201        currentMatchNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
202        currentReplayNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
203        currentMatchType = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchType;
204      } finally {
205        m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
206      }
207      currentControlWord = HAL.nativeGetControlWord();
208
209      if (oldIsRedAlliance != isRedAlliance) {
210        alliance.setBoolean(isRedAlliance);
211        oldIsRedAlliance = isRedAlliance;
212      }
213      if (oldStationNumber != stationNumber) {
214        station.setDouble(stationNumber);
215        oldStationNumber = stationNumber;
216      }
217      if (!oldEventName.equals(currentEventName)) {
218        eventName.setString(currentEventName);
219        oldEventName = currentEventName;
220      }
221      if (!oldGameSpecificMessage.equals(currentGameSpecificMessage)) {
222        gameSpecificMessage.setString(currentGameSpecificMessage);
223        oldGameSpecificMessage = currentGameSpecificMessage;
224      }
225      if (currentMatchNumber != oldMatchNumber) {
226        matchNumber.setDouble(currentMatchNumber);
227        oldMatchNumber = currentMatchNumber;
228      }
229      if (currentReplayNumber != oldReplayNumber) {
230        replayNumber.setDouble(currentReplayNumber);
231        oldReplayNumber = currentReplayNumber;
232      }
233      if (currentMatchType != oldMatchType) {
234        matchType.setDouble(currentMatchType);
235        oldMatchType = currentMatchType;
236      }
237      if (currentControlWord != oldControlWord) {
238        controlWord.setDouble(currentControlWord);
239        oldControlWord = currentControlWord;
240      }
241    }
242  }
243
244  private static class JoystickLogSender {
245    JoystickLogSender(DataLog log, int stick, long timestamp) {
246      m_stick = stick;
247
248      m_logButtons = new BooleanArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/buttons", timestamp);
249      m_logAxes = new FloatArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/axes", timestamp);
250      m_logPOVs = new IntegerArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/povs", timestamp);
251
252      appendButtons(timestamp);
253      appendAxes(timestamp);
254      appendPOVs(timestamp);
255    }
256
257    public void send(long timestamp) {
258      if (m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_count
259          || m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_buttons) {
260        appendButtons(timestamp);
261      }
262
263      if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_count) {
264        appendAxes(timestamp);
265      } else {
266        int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
267        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
268          if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes[i] != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_axes[i]) {
269            appendAxes(timestamp);
270            break;
271          }
272        }
273      }
274
275      if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_count) {
276        appendPOVs(timestamp);
277      } else {
278        int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
279        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
280          if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i] != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_povs[i]) {
281            appendPOVs(timestamp);
282            break;
283          }
284        }
285      }
286    }
287
288    void appendButtons(long timestamp) {
289      int count = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count;
290      if (m_sizedButtons == null || m_sizedButtons.length != count) {
291        m_sizedButtons = new boolean[count];
292      }
293      int buttons = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons;
294      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
295        m_sizedButtons[i] = (buttons & (1 << i)) != 0;
296      }
297      m_logButtons.append(m_sizedButtons, timestamp);
298    }
299
300    void appendAxes(long timestamp) {
301      int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
302      if (m_sizedAxes == null || m_sizedAxes.length != count) {
303        m_sizedAxes = new float[count];
304      }
305      System.arraycopy(m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes, 0, m_sizedAxes, 0, count);
306      m_logAxes.append(m_sizedAxes, timestamp);
307    }
308
309    void appendPOVs(long timestamp) {
310      int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
311      if (m_sizedPOVs == null || m_sizedPOVs.length != count) {
312        m_sizedPOVs = new long[count];
313      }
314      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
315        m_sizedPOVs[i] = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i];
316      }
317      m_logPOVs.append(m_sizedPOVs, timestamp);
318    }
319
320    final int m_stick;
321    boolean[] m_sizedButtons;
322    float[] m_sizedAxes;
323    long[] m_sizedPOVs;
324    final BooleanArrayLogEntry m_logButtons;
325    final FloatArrayLogEntry m_logAxes;
326    final IntegerArrayLogEntry m_logPOVs;
327  }
328
329  private static class DataLogSender {
330    DataLogSender(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks, long timestamp) {
331      m_logEnabled = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:enabled", timestamp);
332      m_logAutonomous = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:autonomous", timestamp);
333      m_logTest = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:test", timestamp);
334      m_logEstop = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:estop", timestamp);
335
336      // append initial control word values
337      m_wasEnabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
338      m_wasAutonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
339      m_wasTest = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
340      m_wasEstop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
341
342      m_logEnabled.append(m_wasEnabled, timestamp);
343      m_logAutonomous.append(m_wasAutonomous, timestamp);
344      m_logTest.append(m_wasTest, timestamp);
345      m_logEstop.append(m_wasEstop, timestamp);
346
347      if (logJoysticks) {
348        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[kJoystickPorts];
349        for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
350          m_joysticks[i] = new JoystickLogSender(log, i, timestamp);
351        }
352      } else {
353        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[0];
354      }
355    }
356
357    public void send(long timestamp) {
358      // append control word value changes
359      boolean enabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
360      if (enabled != m_wasEnabled) {
361        m_logEnabled.append(enabled, timestamp);
362      }
363      m_wasEnabled = enabled;
364
365      boolean autonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
366      if (autonomous != m_wasAutonomous) {
367        m_logAutonomous.append(autonomous, timestamp);
368      }
369      m_wasAutonomous = autonomous;
370
371      boolean test = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
372      if (test != m_wasTest) {
373        m_logTest.append(test, timestamp);
374      }
375      m_wasTest = test;
376
377      boolean estop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
378      if (estop != m_wasEstop) {
379        m_logEstop.append(estop, timestamp);
380      }
381      m_wasEstop = estop;
382
383      // append joystick value changes
384      for (JoystickLogSender joystick : m_joysticks) {
385        joystick.send(timestamp);
386      }
387    }
388
389    boolean m_wasEnabled;
390    boolean m_wasAutonomous;
391    boolean m_wasTest;
392    boolean m_wasEstop;
393    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEnabled;
394    final BooleanLogEntry m_logAutonomous;
395    final BooleanLogEntry m_logTest;
396    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEstop;
397
398    final JoystickLogSender[] m_joysticks;
399  }
400
401  private static DriverStation instance = new DriverStation();
402
403  // Joystick User Data
404  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxes = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
405  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
406  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtons = new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
407  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfo = new MatchInfoData();
408
409  // Joystick Cached Data
410  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxesCache = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
411  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVsCache = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
412  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtonsCache =
413      new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
414  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfoCache = new MatchInfoData();
415
416  // Joystick button rising/falling edge flags
417  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsPressed = new int[kJoystickPorts];
418  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsReleased = new int[kJoystickPorts];
419
420  // preallocated byte buffer for button count
421  private static final ByteBuffer m_buttonCountBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(1);
422
423  private static final MatchDataSender m_matchDataSender;
424  private static DataLogSender m_dataLogSender;
425
426  // Internal Driver Station thread
427  private static Thread m_thread;
428
429  private static volatile boolean m_threadKeepAlive = true;
430
431  private static final ReentrantLock m_cacheDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
432
433  private static final Lock m_waitForDataMutex;
434  private static final Condition m_waitForDataCond;
435  private static int m_waitForDataCount;
436  private static final ThreadLocal<Integer> m_lastCount = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> 0);
437
438  private static boolean m_silenceJoystickWarning;
439
440  // Robot state status variables
441  private static boolean m_userInDisabled;
442  private static boolean m_userInAutonomous;
443  private static boolean m_userInTeleop;
444  private static boolean m_userInTest;
445
446  // Control word variables
447  private static final ReentrantLock m_controlWordMutex = new ReentrantLock();
448  private static final ControlWord m_controlWordCache;
449  private static long m_lastControlWordUpdate;
450
451  /**
452   * Gets an instance of the DriverStation.
453   *
454   * @return The DriverStation.
455   * @deprecated Use the static methods
456   */
457  @Deprecated
458  public static DriverStation getInstance() {
459    return DriverStation.instance;
460  }
461
462  /**
463   * DriverStation constructor.
464   *
465   * <p>The single DriverStation instance is created statically with the instance static member
466   * variable.
467   */
468  private DriverStation() {}
469
470  static {
471    HAL.initialize(500, 0);
472    m_waitForDataCount = 0;
473    m_waitForDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
474    m_waitForDataCond = m_waitForDataMutex.newCondition();
475
476    for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
477      m_joystickButtons[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
478      m_joystickAxes[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
479      m_joystickPOVs[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
480
481      m_joystickButtonsCache[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
482      m_joystickAxesCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
483      m_joystickPOVsCache[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
484    }
485
486    m_controlWordCache = new ControlWord();
487    m_lastControlWordUpdate = 0;
488
489    m_matchDataSender = new MatchDataSender();
490
491    m_thread = new Thread(new DriverStationTask(), "FRCDriverStation");
492    m_thread.setPriority((Thread.NORM_PRIORITY + Thread.MAX_PRIORITY) / 2);
493
494    m_thread.start();
495  }
496
497  /** Kill the thread. */
498  public static synchronized void release() {
499    m_threadKeepAlive = false;
500    if (m_thread != null) {
501      try {
502        m_thread.join();
503      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
504        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
505      }
506      m_thread = null;
507    }
508  }
509
510  /**
511   * Report error to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to error message.
512   *
513   * @param error The error to report.
514   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to error string
515   */
516  public static void reportError(String error, boolean printTrace) {
517    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, printTrace);
518  }
519
520  /**
521   * Report error to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to error message.
522   *
523   * @param error The error to report.
524   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
525   */
526  public static void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
527    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, stackTrace);
528  }
529
530  /**
531   * Report warning to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to warning message.
532   *
533   * @param warning The warning to report.
534   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to warning string
535   */
536  public static void reportWarning(String warning, boolean printTrace) {
537    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, printTrace);
538  }
539
540  /**
541   * Report warning to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to warning message.
542   *
543   * @param warning The warning to report.
544   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
545   */
546  public static void reportWarning(String warning, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
547    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, stackTrace);
548  }
549
550  private static void reportErrorImpl(boolean isError, int code, String error, boolean printTrace) {
551    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, printTrace, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(), 3);
552  }
553
554  private static void reportErrorImpl(
555      boolean isError, int code, String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
556    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, true, stackTrace, 0);
557  }
558
559  private static void reportErrorImpl(
560      boolean isError,
561      int code,
562      String error,
563      boolean printTrace,
564      StackTraceElement[] stackTrace,
565      int stackTraceFirst) {
566    String locString;
567    if (stackTrace.length >= stackTraceFirst + 1) {
568      locString = stackTrace[stackTraceFirst].toString();
569    } else {
570      locString = "";
571    }
572    StringBuilder traceString = new StringBuilder();
573    if (printTrace) {
574      boolean haveLoc = false;
575      for (int i = stackTraceFirst; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
576        String loc = stackTrace[i].toString();
577        traceString.append("\tat ").append(loc).append('\n');
578        // get first user function
579        if (!haveLoc && !loc.startsWith("edu.wpi.first")) {
580          locString = loc;
581          haveLoc = true;
582        }
583      }
584    }
585    HAL.sendError(isError, code, false, error, locString, traceString.toString(), true);
586  }
587
588  /**
589   * The state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
590   *
591   * @param stick The joystick to read.
592   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
593   * @return The state of the joystick button.
594   */
595  public static boolean getStickButton(final int stick, final int button) {
596    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
597      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
598    }
599    if (button <= 0) {
600      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
601      return false;
602    }
603
604    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
605    try {
606      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
607        return (m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0;
608      }
609    } finally {
610      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
611    }
612
613    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
614        "Joystick Button "
615            + button
616            + " on port "
617            + stick
618            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
619    return false;
620  }
621
622  /**
623   * Whether one joystick button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
624   *
625   * @param stick The joystick to read.
626   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
627   * @return Whether the joystick button was pressed since the last check.
628   */
629  public static boolean getStickButtonPressed(final int stick, final int button) {
630    if (button <= 0) {
631      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
632      return false;
633    }
634    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
635      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
636    }
637
638    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
639    try {
640      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
641        // If button was pressed, clear flag and return true
642        if ((m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
643          m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
644          return true;
645        } else {
646          return false;
647        }
648      }
649    } finally {
650      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
651    }
652
653    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
654        "Joystick Button "
655            + button
656            + " on port "
657            + stick
658            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
659    return false;
660  }
661
662  /**
663   * Whether one joystick button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
664   *
665   * @param stick The joystick to read.
666   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
667   * @return Whether the joystick button was released since the last check.
668   */
669  public static boolean getStickButtonReleased(final int stick, final int button) {
670    if (button <= 0) {
671      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
672      return false;
673    }
674    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
675      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
676    }
677
678    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
679    try {
680      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
681        // If button was released, clear flag and return true
682        if ((m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
683          m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
684          return true;
685        } else {
686          return false;
687        }
688      }
689    } finally {
690      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
691    }
692
693    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
694        "Joystick Button "
695            + button
696            + " on port "
697            + stick
698            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
699    return false;
700  }
701
702  /**
703   * Get the value of the axis on a joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected
704   * to the specified port.
705   *
706   * @param stick The joystick to read.
707   * @param axis The analog axis value to read from the joystick.
708   * @return The value of the axis on the joystick.
709   */
710  public static double getStickAxis(int stick, int axis) {
711    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
712      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
713    }
714    if (axis < 0 || axis >= HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes) {
715      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick axis is out of range");
716    }
717
718    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
719    try {
720      if (axis < m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count) {
721        return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_axes[axis];
722      }
723    } finally {
724      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
725    }
726
727    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
728        "Joystick axis "
729            + axis
730            + " on port "
731            + stick
732            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
733    return 0.0;
734  }
735
736  /**
737   * Get the state of a POV on the joystick.
738   *
739   * @param stick The joystick to read.
740   * @param pov The POV to read.
741   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
742   */
743  public static int getStickPOV(int stick, int pov) {
744    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
745      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
746    }
747    if (pov < 0 || pov >= HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs) {
748      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick POV is out of range");
749    }
750
751    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
752    try {
753      if (pov < m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count) {
754        return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_povs[pov];
755      }
756    } finally {
757      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
758    }
759
760    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
761        "Joystick POV "
762            + pov
763            + " on port "
764            + stick
765            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
766    return -1;
767  }
768
769  /**
770   * The state of the buttons on the joystick.
771   *
772   * @param stick The joystick to read.
773   * @return The state of the buttons on the joystick.
774   */
775  public static int getStickButtons(final int stick) {
776    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
777      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
778    }
779
780    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
781    try {
782      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons;
783    } finally {
784      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
785    }
786  }
787
788  /**
789   * Returns the number of axes on a given joystick port.
790   *
791   * @param stick The joystick port number
792   * @return The number of axes on the indicated joystick
793   */
794  public static int getStickAxisCount(int stick) {
795    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
796      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
797    }
798
799    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
800    try {
801      return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count;
802    } finally {
803      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
804    }
805  }
806
807  /**
808   * Returns the number of POVs on a given joystick port.
809   *
810   * @param stick The joystick port number
811   * @return The number of POVs on the indicated joystick
812   */
813  public static int getStickPOVCount(int stick) {
814    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
815      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
816    }
817
818    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
819    try {
820      return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count;
821    } finally {
822      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
823    }
824  }
825
826  /**
827   * Gets the number of buttons on a joystick.
828   *
829   * @param stick The joystick port number
830   * @return The number of buttons on the indicated joystick
831   */
832  public static int getStickButtonCount(int stick) {
833    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
834      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
835    }
836
837    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
838    try {
839      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count;
840    } finally {
841      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
842    }
843  }

845  /**
846   * Gets the value of isXbox on a joystick.
847   *
848   * @param stick The joystick port number
849   * @return A boolean that returns the value of isXbox
850   */
851  public static boolean getJoystickIsXbox(int stick) {
852    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
853      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
854    }
855
856    return HAL.getJoystickIsXbox((byte) stick) == 1;
857  }
858
859  /**
860   * Gets the value of type on a joystick.
861   *
862   * @param stick The joystick port number
863   * @return The value of type
864   */
865  public static int getJoystickType(int stick) {
866    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
867      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
868    }
869
870    return HAL.getJoystickType((byte) stick);
871  }
872
873  /**
874   * Gets the name of the joystick at a port.
875   *
876   * @param stick The joystick port number
877   * @return The value of name
878   */
879  public static String getJoystickName(int stick) {
880    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
881      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
882    }
883
884    return HAL.getJoystickName((byte) stick);
885  }
886
887  /**
888   * Returns the types of Axes on a given joystick port.
889   *
890   * @param stick The joystick port number
891   * @param axis The target axis
892   * @return What type of axis the axis is reporting to be
893   */
894  public static int getJoystickAxisType(int stick, int axis) {
895    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
896      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
897    }
898
899    return HAL.getJoystickAxisType((byte) stick, (byte) axis);
900  }
901
902  /**
903   * Returns if a joystick is connected to the Driver Station.
904   *
905   * <p>This makes a best effort guess by looking at the reported number of axis, buttons, and POVs
906   * attached.
907   *
908   * @param stick The joystick port number
909   * @return true if a joystick is connected
910   */
911  public static boolean isJoystickConnected(int stick) {
912    return getStickAxisCount(stick) > 0
913        || getStickButtonCount(stick) > 0
914        || getStickPOVCount(stick) > 0;
915  }
916
917  /**
918   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be enabled.
919   *
920   * @return True if the robot is enabled, false otherwise.
921   */
922  public static boolean isEnabled() {
923    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
924    try {
925      updateControlWord(false);
926      return m_controlWordCache.getEnabled() && m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
927    } finally {
928      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
929    }
930  }
931
932  /**
933   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be disabled.
934   *
935   * @return True if the robot should be disabled, false otherwise.
936   */
937  public static boolean isDisabled() {
938    return !isEnabled();
939  }
940
941  /**
942   * Gets a value indicating whether the Robot is e-stopped.
943   *
944   * @return True if the robot is e-stopped, false otherwise.
945   */
946  public static boolean isEStopped() {
947    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
948    try {
949      updateControlWord(false);
950      return m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
951    } finally {
952      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
953    }
954  }
955
956  /**
957   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
958   * autonomous mode.
959   *
960   * @return True if autonomous mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
961   */
962  public static boolean isAutonomous() {
963    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
964    try {
965      updateControlWord(false);
966      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
967    } finally {
968      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
969    }
970  }
971
972  /**
973   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
974   * autonomous mode and enabled.
975   *
976   * @return True if autonomous should be set and the robot should be enabled.
977   */
978  public static boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
979    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
980    try {
981      updateControlWord(false);
982      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous() && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
983    } finally {
984      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
985    }
986  }
987
988  /**
989   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
990   * operator-controlled mode.
991   *
992   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
993   * @deprecated Use isTeleop() instead.
994   */
995  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
996  public static boolean isOperatorControl() {
997    return isTeleop();
998  }
999
1000  /**
1001   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
1002   * operator-controlled mode.
1003   *
1004   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
1005   */
1006  public static boolean isTeleop() {
1007    return !(isAutonomous() || isTest());
1008  }
1009
1010  /**
1011   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
1012   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
1013   *
1014   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
1015   * @deprecated Use isTeleopEnabled() instead.
1016   */
1017  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
1018  public static boolean isOperatorControlEnabled() {
1019    return isTeleopEnabled();
1020  }
1021
1022  /**
1023   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
1024   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
1025   *
1026   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
1027   */
1028  public static boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
1029    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1030    try {
1031      updateControlWord(false);
1032      return !m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous()
1033          && !m_controlWordCache.getTest()
1034          && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
1035    } finally {
1036      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1037    }
1038  }
1039
1040  /**
1041   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in test
1042   * mode.
1043   *
1044   * @return True if test mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
1045   */
1046  public static boolean isTest() {
1047    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1048    try {
1049      updateControlWord(false);
1050      return m_controlWordCache.getTest();
1051    } finally {
1052      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1053    }
1054  }
1055
1056  /**
1057   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station is attached.
1058   *
1059   * @return True if Driver Station is attached, false otherwise.
1060   */
1061  public static boolean isDSAttached() {
1062    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1063    try {
1064      updateControlWord(false);
1065      return m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
1066    } finally {
1067      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1068    }
1069  }
1070
1071  /**
1072   * Gets if a new control packet from the driver station arrived since the last time this function
1073   * was called.
1074   *
1075   * @return True if the control data has been updated since the last call.
1076   */
1077  public static boolean isNewControlData() {
1078    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1079    try {
1080      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1081      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1082        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1083        return true;
1084      }
1085    } finally {
1086      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1087    }
1088    return false;
1089  }
1090
1091  /**
1092   * Gets if the driver station attached to a Field Management System.
1093   *
1094   * @return true if the robot is competing on a field being controlled by a Field Management System
1095   */
1096  public static boolean isFMSAttached() {
1097    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1098    try {
1099      updateControlWord(false);
1100      return m_controlWordCache.getFMSAttached();
1101    } finally {
1102      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1103    }
1104  }

1106  /**
1107   * Get the game specific message.
1108   *
1109   * @return the game specific message
1110   */
1111  public static String getGameSpecificMessage() {
1112    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1113    try {
1114      return m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
1115    } finally {
1116      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1117    }
1118  }
1119
1120  /**
1121   * Get the event name.
1122   *
1123   * @return the event name
1124   */
1125  public static String getEventName() {
1126    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1127    try {
1128      return m_matchInfo.eventName;
1129    } finally {
1130      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1131    }
1132  }
1133
1134  /**
1135   * Get the match type.
1136   *
1137   * @return the match type
1138   */
1139  public static MatchType getMatchType() {
1140    int matchType;
1141    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1142    try {
1143      matchType = m_matchInfo.matchType;
1144    } finally {
1145      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1146    }
1147    switch (matchType) {
1148      case 1:
1149        return MatchType.Practice;
1150      case 2:
1151        return MatchType.Qualification;
1152      case 3:
1153        return MatchType.Elimination;
1154      default:
1155        return MatchType.None;
1156    }
1157  }
1158
1159  /**
1160   * Get the match number.
1161   *
1162   * @return the match number
1163   */
1164  public static int getMatchNumber() {
1165    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1166    try {
1167      return m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
1168    } finally {
1169      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1170    }
1171  }

1174   * Get the replay number.
1175   *
1176   * @return the replay number
1177   */
1178  public static int getReplayNumber() {
1179    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1180    try {
1181      return m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
1182    } finally {
1183      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1184    }
1185  }
1186
1187  /**
1188   * Get the current alliance from the FMS.
1189   *
1190   * @return the current alliance
1191   */
1192  public static Alliance getAlliance() {
1193    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1194    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1195      return Alliance.Invalid;
1196    }
1197
1198    switch (allianceStationID) {
1199      case Red1:
1200      case Red2:
1201      case Red3:
1202        return Alliance.Red;
1203
1204      case Blue1:
1205      case Blue2:
1206      case Blue3:
1207        return Alliance.Blue;
1208
1209      default:
1210        return Alliance.Invalid;
1211    }
1212  }
1213
1214  /**
1215   * Gets the location of the team's driver station controls.
1216   *
1217   * @return the location of the team's driver station controls: 1, 2, or 3
1218   */
1219  public static int getLocation() {
1220    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1221    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1222      return 0;
1223    }
1224    switch (allianceStationID) {
1225      case Red1:
1226      case Blue1:
1227        return 1;
1228
1229      case Red2:
1230      case Blue2:
1231        return 2;
1232
1233      case Blue3:
1234      case Red3:
1235        return 3;
1236
1237      default:
1238        return 0;
1239    }
1240  }
1241
1242  /**
1243   * Wait for new data from the driver station.
1244   *
1245   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1246   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1247   */
1248  public static void waitForData() {
1249    waitForData(0);
1250  }
1251
1252  /**
1253   * Wait for new data or for timeout, which ever comes first. If timeout is 0, wait for new data
1254   * only.
1255   *
1256   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1257   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1258   *
1259   * @param timeoutSeconds The maximum time in seconds to wait.
1260   * @return true if there is new data, otherwise false
1261   */
1262  public static boolean waitForData(double timeoutSeconds) {
1263    long startTimeMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1264    long timeoutMicroS = (long) (timeoutSeconds * 1e6);
1265    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1266    try {
1267      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1268      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1269        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1270        return true;
1271      }
1272      while (m_waitForDataCount == currentCount) {
1273        if (timeoutMicroS > 0) {
1274          long nowMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1275          if (nowMicroS < startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS) {
1276            // We still have time to wait
1277            boolean signaled =
1278                m_waitForDataCond.await(
1279                    startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS - nowMicroS, TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS);
1280            if (!signaled) {
1281              // Return false if a timeout happened
1282              return false;
1283            }
1284          } else {
1285            // Time has elapsed.
1286            return false;
1287          }
1288        } else {
1289          m_waitForDataCond.await();
1290        }
1291      }
1292      m_lastCount.set(m_waitForDataCount);
1293      // Return true if we have received a proper signal
1294      return true;
1295    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1296      // return false on a thread interrupt
1297      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1298      return false;
1299    } finally {
1300      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1301    }
1302  }
1303
1304  /**
1305   * Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not send an official match time to the robots,
1306   * but does send an approximate match time. The value will count down the time remaining in the
1307   * current period (auto or teleop). Warning: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to
1308   * dispute ref calls or guarantee that a function will trigger before the match ends) The Practice
1309   * Match function of the DS approximates the behavior seen on the field.
1310   *
1311   * @return Time remaining in current match period (auto or teleop) in seconds
1312   */
1313  public static double getMatchTime() {
1314    return HAL.getMatchTime();
1315  }
1316
1317  /**
1318   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1319   * purposes only.
1320   *
1321   * @param entering If true, starting disabled code; if false, leaving disabled code
1322   */
1323  public static void inDisabled(boolean entering) {
1324    m_userInDisabled = entering;
1325  }
1326

1328   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1329   * purposes only.

1332   */
1333  public static void inAutonomous(boolean entering) {
1334    m_userInAutonomous = entering;

1339   * purposes only.

1342   * @deprecated Use {@link #inTeleop(boolean)} instead.

1344  @Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
1345  public static void inOperatorControl(boolean entering) {
1346    m_userInTeleop = entering;

1361   * purposes only.

1368
1369  /** Forces waitForData() to return immediately. */
1370  public static void wakeupWaitForData() {
1371    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1372    try {
1373      m_waitForDataCount++;
1374      m_waitForDataCond.signalAll();
1375    } finally {
1376      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1377    }
1378  }
1379
1380  /**
1381   * Allows the user to specify whether they want joystick connection warnings to be printed to the
1382   * console. This setting is ignored when the FMS is connected -- warnings will always be on in
1383   * that scenario.
1384   *
1385   * @param silence Whether warning messages should be silenced.
1386   */
1387  public static void silenceJoystickConnectionWarning(boolean silence) {
1388    m_silenceJoystickWarning = silence;
1389  }
1390
1391  /**
1392   * Returns whether joystick connection warnings are silenced. This will always return false when
1393   * connected to the FMS.
1394   *
1395   * @return Whether joystick connection warnings are silenced.
1396   */
1397  public static boolean isJoystickConnectionWarningSilenced() {
1398    return !isFMSAttached() && m_silenceJoystickWarning;
1399  }
1400
1401  /**
1402   * Copy data from the DS task for the user. If no new data exists, it will just be returned,
1403   * otherwise the data will be copied from the DS polling loop.
1404   */
1405  protected static void getData() {
1406    // Get the status of all of the joysticks
1407    for (byte stick = 0; stick < kJoystickPorts; stick++) {
1408      m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_count =
1409          HAL.getJoystickAxes(stick, m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_axes);
1410      m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_count =
1411          HAL.getJoystickPOVs(stick, m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_povs);
1412      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_buttons = HAL.getJoystickButtons(stick, m_buttonCountBuffer);
1413      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_count = m_buttonCountBuffer.get(0);
1414    }
1415
1416    HAL.getMatchInfo(m_matchInfoCache);
1417
1418    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1419    try {
1420      // Force a control word update, to make sure the data is the newest.
1421      updateControlWord(true);
1422    } finally {
1423      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1424    }
1425
1426    DataLogSender dataLogSender;
1427    // lock joystick mutex to swap cache data
1428    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1429    try {
1430      for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
1431        // If buttons weren't pressed and are now, set flags in m_buttonsPressed
1432        m_joystickButtonsPressed[i] |=
1433            ~m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1434
1435        // If buttons were pressed and aren't now, set flags in m_buttonsReleased
1436        m_joystickButtonsReleased[i] |=
1437            m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & ~m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1438      }
1439
1440      // move cache to actual data
1441      HALJoystickAxes[] currentAxes = m_joystickAxes;
1442      m_joystickAxes = m_joystickAxesCache;
1443      m_joystickAxesCache = currentAxes;
1444
1445      HALJoystickButtons[] currentButtons = m_joystickButtons;
1446      m_joystickButtons = m_joystickButtonsCache;
1447      m_joystickButtonsCache = currentButtons;
1448
1449      HALJoystickPOVs[] currentPOVs = m_joystickPOVs;
1450      m_joystickPOVs = m_joystickPOVsCache;
1451      m_joystickPOVsCache = currentPOVs;
1452
1453      MatchInfoData currentInfo = m_matchInfo;
1454      m_matchInfo = m_matchInfoCache;
1455      m_matchInfoCache = currentInfo;
1456
1457      dataLogSender = m_dataLogSender;
1458    } finally {
1459      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1460    }
1461
1462    wakeupWaitForData();
1463    m_matchDataSender.sendMatchData();
1464    if (dataLogSender != null) {
1465      dataLogSender.send(WPIUtilJNI.now());
1466    }
1467  }
1468
1469  /**
1470   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1471   * the DS.
1472   */
1473  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedError(String message) {
1474    double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1475    if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1476      reportError(message, false);
1477      m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1478    }
1479  }
1480
1481  /**
1482   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1483   * the DS.
1484   */
1485  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(String message) {
1486    if (isFMSAttached() || !m_silenceJoystickWarning) {
1487      double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1488      if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1489        reportWarning(message, false);
1490        m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1491      }
1492    }
1493  }
1494
1495  /** Provides the service routine for the DS polling m_thread. */
1496  private static void run() {
1497    int safetyCounter = 0;
1498    while (m_threadKeepAlive) {
1499      HAL.waitForDSData();
1500      getData();
1501
1502      if (isDisabled()) {
1503        safetyCounter = 0;
1504      }
1505
1506      safetyCounter++;
1507      if (safetyCounter >= 4) {
1508        MotorSafety.checkMotors();
1509        safetyCounter = 0;
1510      }
1511      if (m_userInDisabled) {
1512        HAL.observeUserProgramDisabled();
1513      }
1514      if (m_userInAutonomous) {
1515        HAL.observeUserProgramAutonomous();
1516      }
1517      if (m_userInTeleop) {
1518        HAL.observeUserProgramTeleop();
1519      }
1520      if (m_userInTest) {
1521        HAL.observeUserProgramTest();
1522      }
1523    }
1524  }
1525
1526  /**
1527   * Forces a control word cache update, and update the passed in control word.
1528   *
1529   * @param word Word to update.
1530   */
1531  public static void updateControlWordFromCache(ControlWord word) {
1532    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1533    try {
1534      updateControlWord(true);
1535      word.update(m_controlWordCache);
1536    } finally {
1537      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1538    }
1539  }
1540
1541  /**
1542   * Updates the data in the control word cache. Updates if the force parameter is set, or if 50ms
1543   * have passed since the last update.
1544   *
1545   * <p>Must be called with m_controlWordMutex lock held.
1546   *
1547   * @param force True to force an update to the cache, otherwise update if 50ms have passed.
1548   */
1549  private static void updateControlWord(boolean force) {
1550    long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1551    if (now - m_lastControlWordUpdate > 50 || force) {
1552      HAL.getControlWord(m_controlWordCache);
1553      m_lastControlWordUpdate = now;
1554    }
1555  }
1556
1557  /**
1558   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log. Repeated calls are ignored.
1559   *
1560   * @param log data log
1561   * @param logJoysticks if true, log joystick data
1562   */
1563  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.NonThreadSafeSingleton")
1564  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks) {
1565    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1566    try {
1567      if (m_dataLogSender == null) {
1568        m_dataLogSender = new DataLogSender(log, logJoysticks, WPIUtilJNI.now());
1569      }
1570    } finally {
1571      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1572    }
1573  }
1574
1575  /**
1576   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log, including joystick data. Repeated calls are
1577   * ignored.
1578   *
1579   * @param log data log
1580   */
1581  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log) {
1582    startDataLog(log, true);
1583  }
1584}
